results.title: Freda Koblicks plastics workshop
results.brief_description: Freda Koblicks conducts plastics workshops and during these, discusses her ideas about working with plastics. These ideas concern not only techniques but also appreciation of dealing with the material.

results.title: Fred Winter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
A film portrait of Fred Winter, one of Britain’s leading steeplechase jockeys. Fred started riding at the age of four; now in his thirties, his outstanding career has seen him winner of the Grand National, twice winner of the Champion Hurdle, and four times Champion Jockey. Sequences show him in action during races, at home with his wife and children in consultation with a trainer.

results.title: Fred Astaire: change partners and dance
results.creator_credit: David Heeley, Educational Broadcasting Corporation and Public Television Stations
results.brief_description: The famous dancing partnership of Ginger Rogers and Fred Astaire ended in 1939 but this did not mean the end for Fred Astaire. In this documentary you will see Astaire “change partners and dance” like never before. Using excerpts from many of his films including “You’ll never get rich” (1941), “Daddy Long Legs” (1955), “Funny face” (1957), we meet some of those partners, often highly regarded in their own right, including Rita Hayworth, Betty Hutton, Leslie Caron, Audrey Hepburn and Barrie Chase. The passing decades reflect Astaire’s change in his dancing movements from swing and tap of the 1940s to cool jazz of the 1950s and 1960s. Also includes interviews with Leslie Caron, Barrie Chase, Bob Fosse, Rodolf Nureyev, Hermes Pan, Jerome Robbins, Roland Petit and others with some rare footage from Astaire’s first television appearance in 1958 on “Toast of the town”. Last but not least is an excerpt from his final television special in 1968 featuring the classic “Puttin’ on the ritz”. Contains b&w footage. Narrated by Joanne Woodward.

results.title: Fraser's River
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, Tim Wilson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film traces the Fraser River from its source in the Rocky Mountains to its mouth, where the city of Vancouver stands. The influence of the Fraser as a provincial lifeline of commerce and communication, and as a transportation link with the rest of Canada, is shown.

results.title: Franklin River journey
results.creator_credit: Bob Connolly, Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film depicts a three week journey down the Franklin River by botanist Antonius Moscal. Portrays his appreciation of the environment and the studies which he carries out. Suitable for Middle Secondary level. Narration by John Bluthal.

results.title: Franklin River blockade
results.creator_credit: Roger Scholes, Kath Scholes and Nick Housego
results.brief_description: Documents the massive non-violent civil disobedience against the building of the Gordon below Franklin Hydro-electric scheme between December 1982 and March 1983. It is the story of the largest peaceful direct action Australia has witnessed. It vividly portrays confrontation in a wilderness under threat a clash of attitudes. Includes interviews with Dick Smith, David Bellamy and Bob Brown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Scholes, Kath Scholes and Nick Housego

results.title: Franklin
results.creator_credit: John Van Bruggen, Nelvana and Neurones
results.brief_description: Franklin is a young green turtle, who, like most youngsters is having fun growing up and learning important things as he goes. Three episodes show some of his adventures. In “Franklin’s Kite” Franklin learns that throwing out a broken toy is not always the best thing to do. “Franklin is Bossy” teaches Franklin that everyone has to take a turn and in “Finders Keepers for Franklin” he realizes that finding something means that somebody has lost it in the first place and may want it back.

results.title: Frankie Howerd on campus
results.creator_credit: Ian Hamilton, Paul Lewis, ITV and LWT
results.brief_description: Recorded live for television at The Oxford Union Society, Oxford University, this stand-up performance of one of Britain’s most outrageous and favourite comedians, Frankie Howerd, is thoroughly entertaining.

results.title: Frankenskippy: totally nuts and bolts
results.creator_credit: Lars Magnus Holmgren, Conja, Linda Lum and MTV Concepts
results.brief_description: This tape contains three thirty second experimental video art clips sponsored by MTV concepts. Individual titles include ‘Blow fly heaven’, ‘Food for thought’ and ‘Frankenskippy’.
